content.description: Dux propius militibus quam hostibus stat.
content.question: How is the sentence translated?

choices.label: The leader stands closer to the soldiers than to the enemies.
The leader of the soldiers stands rather far from the enemies.
The leader stands as close to the soldiers as he does to the enemies.
The leader of the enemies stands as far as possible from the soldiers.

content.answer: The leader stands closer to the soldiers than to the enemies.
